message: Calm and stable. Physically and mentally balanced. Maintain your routine.
Slight stress but fully manageable. Good control over emotions and workload.
You're doing fine. Small stress signals may appear—sleep and hydration matter.
Low stress. Keep up healthy habits before it creeps up unnoticed.
Mild tension. Probably workload or personal pressure—short breaks will help.
Noticeable stress. Productivity and patience may start dipping. Reset your pace.
Moderate stress. You're pushing through but not comfortably. Re-evaluate priorities.
Rising stress. Your body/mind is asking for rest—don't ignore basic needs.
Clear signs of stress. Overthinking and fatigue likely. Reduce stimulation and slow down.
Stress impacting focus and mood. The longer you drag this, the harder it rebounds.
High tension mode. Sleep patterns and productivity may be compromised. Prioritize recovery.
Stress affecting your daily functioning. You need a reset—social support and rest help.
Strong stress response. Irritability/overwhelm likely. Stop pushing through.
Chronic stress symptoms forming. You need a break—not negotiation, but necessity.
Very high stress. Performance and health both at risk. Cut down responsibilities immediately.
Danger zone. Mental and physical strain increasing. Get breathing room and talk to someone.
Severe stress. Body is nearing shutdown mode. Don't rationalize working through this.
Critical stress level. Anxiety or burnout signs likely. You need structured support and rest.
Extremely high stress. You're not coping — health risk is real. Seek personal or professional support.
Emergency level. This is not sustainable. Immediate intervention and help required — don't wait.
